page.title: 09EDUCATION IN COWFOLD.
page.content: {OTHER SCHOOLS.}In 1801 a Boy's School was founded at Brookhill by The Rev.R. Constable.The first master was called Charles Kettle.Later on there was a Girl's School on a site near the present school.For some years there was a Grammar School for boys at Bull's Bridge. {ST PETER'S SCHOOL.}The present school was built in 1870 by Richard Hoper at his own cost.In 1909 it was enlarged and it was rebuilt in its present form in 1965.The school caters for children aged from 5 to 11 and has 74 children on roll.The school has a large playing field and a swimming pool which was built by the village in memory of three local boys who were drowned at Wittering.At 11 the children go to Comprehensive Schools in Horsham or Steyning.The headmaster is Mr.R.Smith.
